alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; New Kent; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chesterfield, northwestern New Kent, Henrico and southeastern Hanover Counties and the City of Richmond through 300 AM EDT... At 159 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bensley, or near Richmond, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... University Of Richmond around 205 AM EDT. Downtown Richmond around 210 AM EDT. Virginia Commonwealth University and Virginia Union University around 215 AM EDT. Richmond around 220 AM EDT. Highland Springs, East Highland Park and Lakeside around 225 AM EDT. Mechanicsville around 235 AM EDT. Studley around 245 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Richmond Heights, Hanover Airport, Orapax Farms, Elko, Elmont, Montrose, Sandston, Longdale, Glendale and Westwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; New Kent; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond)
